00020 /** \file
00021  \brief main obdlogger entrypoint
00022  */
00023 
00024 // Some references:
00025 // mpg calculation: http://www.mp3car.com/vbulletin/engine-management-obd-ii-engine-diagnostics-etc/75138-calculating-mpg-vss-maf-obd2.html
00026 // function list: http://www.kbmsystems.net/obd_tech.htm
00027 
00028 #include "obdconfig.h"
00029 #include "main.h"
00030 #include "obdservicecommands.h"
00031 #include "database.h"
00032 #include "obddb.h"
00033 #include "gpsdb.h"
00034 #include "ecudb.h"
00035 #include "tripdb.h"
00036 #include "obdserial.h"
00037 #include "gpscomm.h"
00038 #include "supportedcommands.h"
00039 
00040 #include "obdconfigfile.h"
00041 
00042 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00043 #include "gps.h"
00044 
00045 /// IP address of gpsd
00046 #define GPSD_ADDR "127.0.0.1"
00047 
00048 /// Port of gpsd
00049 #define GPSD_PORT "2947"
00050 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00051 
00052 #ifdef HAVE_DBUS
00053 #include "obddbus.h"
00054 #endif //HAVE_DBUS
00055 
00056 #include "sqlite3.h"
00057 
00058 #include <stdio.h>
00059 #include <string.h>
00060 #include <fcntl.h>
00061 #include <time.h>
00062 #include <getopt.h>
00063 #include <unistd.h>
00064 #include <sys/time.h>
00065 #include <sys/types.h>
00066 #include <sys/stat.h>
00067 
00068 #ifdef HAVE_SIGNAL_H
00069 #include <signal.h>
00070 #endif // HAVE_SIGNAL_H
00071 
00072 /// Commit transactions once every this many seconds
00073 #define TRANSACTIONTIME 8
00074 
00075 /// Set when we catch a signal we want to exit on
00076 static int receive_exitsignal = 0;
00077 
00078 /// If we catch a signal to start the trip, set this
00079 static int sig_starttrip = 0;
00080 
00081 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00082 /// Daemonise. Returns 0 for success, or nonzero on failure.
00083 static int obddaemonise();
00084 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00085 
00086 /// Set up signal handling
00087 static void install_signalhandlers();
00088 
00089 static void catch_quitsignal(int sig) {
00090     receive_exitsignal = 1;
00091 }
00092 
00093 static void catch_tripstartsignal(int sig) {
00094     sig_starttrip = 1;
00095 }
00096 
00097 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00098     /// Serial port full path to open
00099     char *serialport = NULL;
00100 
00101     /// Database file to open
00102     char *databasename = NULL;
00103 
00104     /// List of columsn to log
00105     char *log_columns = NULL;
00106 
00107     /// Number of samples to take
00108     int samplecount = -1;
00109 
00110     /// Number of samples per second
00111     int samplespersecond = 1;
00112 
00113     /// Ask to show the capabilities of the OBD device then exit
00114     int showcapabilities = 0;
00115 
00116     /// Set if the user wishes to upgrade the baudrate
00117     long baudrate_upgrade = -1;
00118 
00119     /// Time between samples, measured in microseconds
00120     long frametime = 0;
00121 
00122     /// Spam all readings to stdout
00123     int spam_stdout = 0;
00124 
00125     /// Enable elm optimisations
00126     int enable_optimisations = 0;
00127 
00128     /// Enable serial logging
00129     int enable_seriallog = 0;
00130 
00131     /// Serial log filename
00132     char *seriallogname = NULL;
00133 
00134 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00135     /// Daemonise
00136     int daemonise = 0;
00137 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00138 
00139     /// Requested baudrate
00140     long requested_baud = -1;
00141 
00142     // Config File
00143     struct OBDGPSConfig *obd_config = obd_loadConfig(0);
00144 
00145     if(NULL != obd_config) {
00146         samplespersecond = obd_config->samplerate;
00147         enable_optimisations = obd_config->optimisations;
00148         requested_baud = obd_config->baudrate;
00149         baudrate_upgrade = obd_config->baudrate_upgrade;
00150     }
00151 
00152     // Do not attempt to buffer stdout at all
00153     setvbuf(stdout, (char *)NULL, _IONBF, 0);
00154 
00155     int optc;
00156     int mustexit = 0;
00157     while ((optc = getopt_long (argc, argv, shortopts, longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00158         switch (optc) {
00159             case 'h':
00160                 printhelp(argv[0]);
00161                 mustexit = 1;
00162                 break;
00163             case 'v':
00164                 printversion();
00165                 mustexit = 1;
00166                 break;
00167             case 's':
00168                 if(NULL != serialport) {
00169                     free(serialport);
00170                 }
00171                 serialport = strdup(optarg);
00172                 break;
00173             case 'o':
00174                 enable_optimisations = 1;
00175                 break;
00176             case 't':
00177                 spam_stdout = 1;
00178                 break;
00179             case 'u':
00180                 {
00181                     int newout = open(optarg, O_CREAT|O_RDWR|O_APPEND,
00182                         S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IROTH);
00183                     if(-1 == newout) {
00184                         perror(optarg);
00185                     } else {
00186                         printf("Redirecting output to %s\n", optarg);
00187                         close(STDOUT_FILENO);
00188                         close(STDERR_FILENO);
00189                         dup2(newout, STDOUT_FILENO);
00190                         dup2(newout, STDERR_FILENO);
00191                     }
00192                 }
00193                 break;
00194 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00195             case 'm':
00196                 daemonise = 1;
00197                 break;
00198 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00199             case 'c':
00200                 samplecount = atoi(optarg);
00201                 break;
00202             case 'b':
00203                 requested_baud = strtol(optarg, (char **)NULL, 10);
00204                 break;
00205             case 'B':
00206                 baudrate_upgrade = strtol(optarg, (char **)NULL, 10);
00207                 break;
00208             case 'd':
00209                 if(NULL != databasename) {
00210                     free(databasename);
00211                 }
00212                 databasename = strdup(optarg);
00213                 break;
00214             case 'i':
00215                 if(NULL != log_columns) {
00216                     free(log_columns);
00217                 }
00218                 log_columns = strdup(optarg);
00219                 break;
00220             case 'a':
00221                 samplespersecond = atoi(optarg);
00222                 break;
00223             case 'l':
00224                 enable_seriallog = 1;
00225                 if(NULL != seriallogname) {
00226                     free(seriallogname);
00227                 }
00228                 seriallogname = strdup(optarg);
00229                 break;
00230             case 'p':
00231                 showcapabilities = 1;
00232                 break;
00233             default:
00234                 mustexit = 1;
00235                 break;
00236         }
00237     }
00238 
00239     if(mustexit) exit(0);
00240 
00241     if(0 >= samplespersecond) {
00242         frametime = 0;
00243     } else {
00244         frametime = 1000000 / samplespersecond;
00245     }
00246 
00247     if(NULL == serialport) {
00248         if(NULL != obd_config && NULL != obd_config->obd_device) {
00249             serialport = strdup(obd_config->obd_device);
00250         } else {
00251             serialport = strdup(OBD_DEFAULT_SERIALPORT);
00252         }
00253     }
00254     if(NULL == databasename) {
00255         if(NULL != obd_config && NULL != obd_config->log_file) {
00256             databasename = strdup(obd_config->log_file);
00257         } else {
00258             databasename = strdup(OBD_DEFAULT_DATABASE);
00259         }
00260     }
00261     if(NULL == log_columns) {
00262         if(NULL != obd_config && NULL != obd_config->log_columns) {
00263             log_columns = strdup(obd_config->log_columns);
00264         } else {
00265             log_columns = strdup(OBD_DEFAULT_COLUMNS);
00266         }
00267     }
00268 
00269 
00270     if(enable_seriallog && NULL != seriallogname) {
00271         startseriallog(seriallogname);
00272     }
00273 
00274 
00275     // Open the serial port.
00276     int obd_serial_port = openserial(serialport, requested_baud, baudrate_upgrade);
00277 
00278     if(-1 == obd_serial_port) {
00279         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't open obd serial port. Attempting to continue.\n");
00280     } else {
00281         fprintf(stderr, "Successfully connected to serial port. Will log obd data\n");
00282     }
00283 
00284     // Just figure out our car's OBD port capabilities and print them
00285     if(showcapabilities) {
00286         printobdcapabilities(obd_serial_port);
00287         
00288         printf("\n");
00289 
00290 /*
00291         unsigned int retvals[50];
00292         int vals_returned;
00293         getobderrorcodes(obd_serial_port,
00294                 retvals, sizeof(retvals)/sizeof(retvals[0]), &vals_returned);
00295 
00296         int q = 0;
00297         int c = retvals[0];
00298         for(q=1;q<1+2*c && q+1<vals_returned;q+=2) {
00299             printf("Error: %s\n", obderrconvert(retvals[q], retvals[q+1]));
00300         }
00301 
00302 */
00303 
00304         closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00305         exit(0);
00306     }
00307 
00308 
00309 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00310     // Open the gps device
00311     struct gps_data_t *gpsdata;
00312     gpsdata = opengps(GPSD_ADDR, GPSD_PORT);
00313 
00314     if(NULL == gpsdata) {
00315         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't open gps port on startup.\n");
00316     } else {
00317         fprintf(stderr, "Successfully connected to gpsd. Will log gps data\n");
00318     }
00319 
00320 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00321 
00322     if(-1 == obd_serial_port
00323 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00324         && NULL == gpsdata
00325 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00326     ) {
00327         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't find either gps or obd to log. Exiting.\n");
00328         exit(1);
00329     }
00330 
00331 #ifdef HAVE_DBUS
00332     obdinitialisedbus();
00333 #endif //HAVE_DBUS
00334 
00335     // sqlite database
00336     sqlite3 *db;
00337 
00338     // sqlite statement
00339     sqlite3_stmt *obdinsert;
00340 
00341     // number of columns in the insert
00342     int obdnumcols;
00343 
00344     // sqlite return status
00345     int rc;
00346 
00347     // Open the database and create the obd table
00348     if(NULL == (db = opendb(databasename))) {
00349         closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00350         exit(1);
00351     }
00352 
00353     // Disable sqlite's synchronous pragma.
00354     /* char *zErrMsg;
00355     rc = sqlite3_exec(db, "PRAGMA synchronous=OFF",
00356                     NULL, NULL, &zErrMsg);
00357     if(rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00358         printf("SQLite error %i: %s\n", rc, zErrMsg);
00359         sqlite3_free(zErrMsg);
00360     } */
00361 
00362     // Wishlist of commands from config file
00363     struct obdservicecmd **wishlist_cmds = NULL;
00364     obd_configCmds(log_columns, &wishlist_cmds);
00365 
00366     void *obdcaps = getobdcapabilities(obd_serial_port,wishlist_cmds);
00367 
00368     obd_freeConfigCmds(wishlist_cmds);
00369     wishlist_cmds=NULL;
00370 
00371     createobdtable(db,obdcaps);
00372 
00373     // Create the insert statement. On success, we'll have the number of columns
00374     if(0 == (obdnumcols = createobdinsertstmt(db,&obdinsert, obdcaps)) || NULL == obdinsert) {
00375         closedb(db);
00376         closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00377         exit(1);
00378     }
00379 
00380     createtriptable(db);
00381 
00382     createecutable(db);
00383 
00384     // All of these have obdnumcols-1 since the last column is time
00385     int cmdlist[obdnumcols-1]; // Commands to send [index into obdcmds_mode1]
00386 
00387     int i,j;
00388     for(i=0,j=0; i<sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0]); i++) {
00389         if(NULL != obdcmds_mode1[i].db_column) {
00390             if(isobdcapabilitysupported(obdcaps,i)) {
00391                 cmdlist[j] = i;
00392                 j++;
00393             }
00394         }
00395     }
00396 
00397     freeobdcapabilities(obdcaps);
00398     // We create the gps table even if gps is disabled, so that other
00399     //  SQL commands expecting the table to at least exist will work.
00400 
00401     // sqlite statement
00402     sqlite3_stmt *gpsinsert;
00403 
00404     // number of columns in the insert
00405     int gpsnumcols;
00406 
00407     creategpstable(db);
00408 
00409     if(0 == (gpsnumcols = creategpsinsertstmt(db, &gpsinsert) || NULL == gpsinsert)) {
00410         closedb(db);
00411         closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00412         exit(1);
00413     }
00414 
00415 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00416     if(daemonise) {
00417         if(0 != obddaemonise()) {
00418             fprintf(stderr,"Couldn't daemonise, exiting\n");
00419             closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00420             exit(1);
00421         }
00422     }
00423 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00424 
00425 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00426     // Ping a message to stdout the first time we get
00427     //   enough of a satellite lock to begin logging
00428     int have_gps_lock = 0;
00429 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00430 
00431 
00432     install_signalhandlers();
00433 
00434 
00435     // The current thing returned by starttrip
00436     sqlite3_int64 currenttrip = 0;
00437 
00438     // Set when we're actually inside a trip
00439     int ontrip = 0;
00440 
00441     // The current time we're inserting
00442     double time_insert;
00443 
00444     // The last time we tried to check the gps daemon
00445     double time_lastgpscheck = 0;
00446 
00447     // Number of samples per transaction
00448     const int basetransactioncount = TRANSACTIONTIME * (0==samplespersecond?10:samplespersecond);
00449 
00450     // Store a few seconds worth of samples per transaction
00451     int transactioncount = 0;
00452 
00453     obdbegintransaction(db);
00454 
00455     while(samplecount == -1 || samplecount-- > 0) {
00456 
00457         struct timeval starttime; // start time through loop
00458         struct timeval endtime; // end time through loop
00459         struct timeval selecttime; // =endtime-starttime [for select()]
00460 
00461         if(0 != gettimeofday(&starttime,NULL)) {
00462             perror("Couldn't gettimeofday");
00463             break;
00464         }
00465 
00466 #ifdef HAVE_DBUS
00467         enum obd_dbus_message msg_ret;
00468         while(OBD_DBUS_NOMESSAGE != (msg_ret = obdhandledbusmessages())) {
00469             switch(msg_ret) {
00470                 case OBD_DBUS_STARTTRIP:
00471                     if(!ontrip) {
00472                         currenttrip = starttrip(db, time_insert);
00473                         fprintf(stderr,"Created a new trip (%i)\n", (int)currenttrip);
00474                         ontrip = 1;
00475                     }
00476                     break;
00477                 case OBD_DBUS_NOMESSAGE:
00478                 default:
00479                     break;
00480             }
00481         }
00482 #endif //HAVE_DBUS
00483 
00484         time_insert = (double)starttime.tv_sec+(double)starttime.tv_usec/1000000.0f;
00485 
00486         if(sig_starttrip) {
00487             if(ontrip) {
00488                 fprintf(stderr,"Ending current trip\n");
00489                 updatetrip(db, currenttrip, time_insert);
00490                 ontrip = 0;
00491             }
00492             currenttrip = starttrip(db, time_insert);
00493             fprintf(stderr,"Created a new trip (%i)\n", (int)currenttrip);
00494             ontrip = 1;
00495             sig_starttrip = 0;
00496         }
00497 
00498         enum obd_serial_status obdstatus;
00499         if(-1 < obd_serial_port) {
00500 
00501             // Get all the OBD data
00502             for(i=0; i<obdnumcols-1; i++) {
00503                 float val;
00504                 unsigned int cmdid = obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]].cmdid;
00505                 int numbytes = enable_optimisations?obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]].bytes_returned:0;
00506                 OBDConvFunc conv = obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]].conv;
00507 
00508                 obdstatus = getobdvalue(obd_serial_port, cmdid, &val, numbytes, conv);
00509                 if(OBD_SUCCESS == obdstatus) {
00510 #ifdef HAVE_DBUS
00511                     obddbussignalpid(&obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]], val);
00512 #endif //HAVE_DBUS
00513                     if(spam_stdout) {
00514                         printf("%s=%f\n", obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]].db_column, val);
00515                     }
00516                     sqlite3_bind_double(obdinsert, i+1, (double)val);
00517                     // printf("cmd: %02X, val: %f\n",obdcmds_mode1[cmdlist[i]].cmdid,val);
00518                 } else {
00519                     break;
00520                 }
00521             }
00522 
00523             if(obdstatus == OBD_SUCCESS) {
00524                 // If they're not on a trip but the engine is going, start a trip
00525                 if(0 == ontrip) {
00526                     printf("Creating a new trip\n");
00527                     currenttrip = starttrip(db, time_insert);
00528                     ontrip = 1;
00529                 }
00530                 sqlite3_bind_double(obdinsert, i+1, time_insert);
00531                 sqlite3_bind_int64(obdinsert, i+2, currenttrip);
00532 
00533                 // Do the OBD insert
00534                 rc = sqlite3_step(obdinsert);
00535                 if(SQLITE_DONE != rc) {
00536                     printf("sqlite3 obd insert failed(%i): %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00537                 }
00538             } else if(OBD_ERROR == obdstatus) {
00539                 fprintf(stderr, "Received OBD_ERROR from serial read. Exiting\n");
00540                 receive_exitsignal = 1;
00541             } else {
00542                 // If they're on a trip, and the engine has desisted, stop the trip
00543                 if(ontrip) {
00544                     printf("Ending current trip\n");
00545                     updatetrip(db, currenttrip, time_insert);
00546                     ontrip = 0;
00547                 }
00548             }
00549             sqlite3_reset(obdinsert);
00550         }
00551 
00552         // Constantly update the trip
00553         updatetrip(db, currenttrip, time_insert);
00554 
00555 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00556         // Get the GPS data
00557         double lat,lon,alt,speed,course,gpstime;
00558 
00559         int gpsstatus = -1;
00560         if(NULL != gpsdata) {
00561             gpsstatus = getgpsposition(gpsdata, &lat, &lon, &alt, &speed, &course, &gpstime);
00562         } else {
00563             if(time_insert - time_lastgpscheck > 10) { // Try again once in a while
00564                 gpsdata = opengps(GPSD_ADDR, GPSD_PORT);
00565                 if(NULL != gpsdata) {
00566                     printf("Delayed connection to gps achieved\n");
00567                 } else {
00568                     // fprintf(stderr, "Delayed connection to gps failed\n");
00569                 }
00570                 time_lastgpscheck = time_insert;
00571             }
00572         }
00573         if(gpsstatus < 0 || NULL == gpsdata) {
00574             // Nothing yet
00575         } else if(gpsstatus >= 0) {
00576             if(0 == have_gps_lock) {
00577                 fprintf(stderr,"GPS acquisition complete\n");
00578                 have_gps_lock = 1;
00579             }
00580 
00581             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 1, lat);
00582             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 2, lon);
00583             if(gpsstatus >= 1) {
00584                 sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 3, alt);
00585             } else {
00586                 sqlite3_bind_null(gpsinsert, 3);
00587             }
00588             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 4, speed);
00589             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 5, course);
00590             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 6, gpstime);
00591 
00592             if(spam_stdout) {
00593                 printf("gpspos=%f,%f,%f,%f,%f\n",
00594                     lat, lon, (gpsstatus>=1?alt:-1000.0), speed, course);
00595             }
00596 
00597             // Use time worked out before.
00598             //  This makes table joins reliable, but the time itself may be wrong depending on gpsd lagginess
00599             sqlite3_bind_double(gpsinsert, 7, time_insert);
00600 
00601             sqlite3_bind_int64(gpsinsert, 8, currenttrip);
00602 
00603             // Do the GPS insert
00604             rc = sqlite3_step(gpsinsert);
00605             if(SQLITE_DONE != rc) {
00606                 printf("sqlite3 gps insert failed(%i): %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00607             }
00608             sqlite3_reset(gpsinsert);
00609         }
00610 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00611 
00612         if(0 != gettimeofday(&endtime,NULL)) {
00613             perror("Couldn't gettimeofday");
00614             break;
00615         }
00616 
00617         // Set via the signal handler
00618         if(receive_exitsignal) {
00619             break;
00620         }
00621 
00622 
00623         // Commit this if we've done more than a certain number
00624         transactioncount++;
00625         transactioncount%=basetransactioncount;
00626         if(0 == transactioncount) {
00627             obdcommittransaction(db);
00628             obdbegintransaction(db);
00629         }
00630 
00631         
00632         // usleep() not as portable as select()
00633 
00634         if(0 < frametime) {
00635             selecttime.tv_sec = endtime.tv_sec - starttime.tv_sec;
00636             if (selecttime.tv_sec != 0) {
00637                     endtime.tv_usec += 1000000*selecttime.tv_sec;
00638                     selecttime.tv_sec = 0;
00639             }
00640             selecttime.tv_usec = (frametime) - 
00641                     (endtime.tv_usec - starttime.tv_usec);
00642             if(selecttime.tv_usec < 0) {
00643                     selecttime.tv_usec = 1;
00644             }
00645             select(0,NULL,NULL,NULL,&selecttime);
00646         }
00647     }
00648 
00649     obdcommittransaction(db);
00650 
00651     if(0 != ontrip) {
00652         updatetrip(db, currenttrip, time_insert);
00653         ontrip = 0;
00654     }
00655 
00656     sqlite3_finalize(obdinsert);
00657     sqlite3_finalize(gpsinsert);
00658 
00659     closeserial(obd_serial_port);
00660 #ifdef HAVE_GPSD
00661     if(NULL != gpsdata) {
00662         gps_close(gpsdata);
00663     }
00664 #endif //HAVE_GPSD
00665     closedb(db);
00666 
00667     if(enable_seriallog) {
00668         closeseriallog();
00669     }
00670 
00671     if(NULL != log_columns) free(log_columns);
00672     if(NULL != databasename) free(databasename);
00673     if(NULL != serialport) free(serialport);
00674 
00675     obd_freeConfig(obd_config);
00676     return 0;
00677 }
00678 
00679 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00680 // *sniff sniff*
00681 // Smells like Stevens.
00682 static int obddaemonise() {
00683     int fd;
00684     pid_t pid = fork();
00685 
00686     switch (pid) {
00687         case -1:
00688             perror("Couldn't fork");
00689             return -1;
00690         case 0: // child
00691             break;
00692         default: // Parent
00693             exit(0);
00694     }
00695 
00696     if (setsid() == -1)
00697         return -1;
00698 
00699     if (chdir("/") == -1)
00700         return -1;
00701 
00702     close(STDIN_FILENO);
00703     close(STDOUT_FILENO);
00704     close(STDERR_FILENO);
00705     if ((fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
00706         dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO);
00707         dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
00708         dup2(fd, STDERR_FILENO);
00709     }
00710 
00711     return 0;
00712 }
00713 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00714 
00715 void printhelp(const char *argv0) {
00716     printf("Usage: %s [params]\n"
00717                 "   [-s|--serial <" OBD_DEFAULT_SERIALPORT ">]\n"
00718                 "   [-c|--count <infinite>]\n"
00719                 "   [-i|--log-columns <" OBD_DEFAULT_COLUMNS ">]\n"
00720                 "   [-t|--spam-stdout]\n"
00721                 "   [-p|--capabilities]\n"
00722                 "   [-o|--enable-optimisations]\n"
00723                 "   [-u|--output-log <filename>]\n"
00724 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00725                 "   [-m|--daemonise]\n"
00726 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00727                 "   [-b|--baud <number>]\n"
00728                 "   [-B|--modifybaud <number>]\n"
00729                 "   [-l|--serial-log <filename>]\n"
00730                 "   [-a|--samplerate [1]]\n"
00731                 "   [-d|--db <" OBD_DEFAULT_DATABASE ">]\n"
00732                 "   [-v|--version] [-h|--help]\n", argv0);
00733 }
00734 
00735 void printversion() {
00736     printf("Version: %i.%i\n", OBDGPSLOGGER_MAJOR_VERSION, OBDGPSLOGGER_MINOR_VERSION);
00737 }

00739 
00740 void install_signalhandlers() {
00741     // Set up signal handling
00742 
00743 #ifdef HAVE_SIGACTION
00744     struct sigaction sa_new;
00745     memset(&sa_new, 0, sizeof(sa_new));
00746 
00747     // Exit on ctrl+c or SIGTERM
00748     sa_new.sa_handler = catch_quitsignal;
00749     sigemptyset(&sa_new.sa_mask);
00750     sigaddset(&sa_new.sa_mask, SIGINT);
00751     sigaddset(&sa_new.sa_mask, SIGTERM);
00752     sigaction(SIGINT, &sa_new, NULL);
00753     sigaction(SIGTERM, &sa_new, NULL);
00754 
00755 #ifdef SIGUSR1
00756     // Start a trip on USR1
00757     sa_new.sa_handler = catch_tripstartsignal;
00758     sa_new.sa_flags &= ~(SA_RESETHAND);
00759     sigemptyset(&sa_new.sa_mask);
00760     sigaddset(&sa_new.sa_mask, SIGUSR1);
00761     sigaction(SIGUSR1, &sa_new, NULL);
00762 #endif //SIGUSR1
00763 
00764 #else // HAVE_SIGACTION
00765 
00766 // If your unix implementation doesn't have sigaction, we can fall
00767 //  back to the older [bad, unsafe] signal().
00768 #ifdef HAVE_SIGNAL_FUNC
00769 
00770     // Exit on ctrl+c or TERM
00771     signal(SIGINT, catch_quitsignal);
00772     signal(SIGTERM, catch_quitsignal);
00773 
00774 #ifdef SIGUSR1
00775     // Start a trip on USR1
00776     signal(SIGUSR1, catch_tripstartsignal);
00777 #endif //SIGUSR1
00778 
00779 #endif // HAVE_SIGNAL_FUNC
00780 
00781 
00782 #endif //HAVE_SIGACTION
00783 
00784 }
Generated on Sun Apr 8 2012 21:46:29 for Logger by  1.7.4
